website_summaries.verdict: A serious scraper that's great for ice on sidewalks and porches but not for car windows.
pros: Solid steel provides the strength to break through layers of ice
Designed for sidewalks, car tire areas, and porch stairs
cons: Not meant for use on windshields

customer_reviews.title: Your search is over!
customer_reviews.text: If you are looking for a quality, AMERICAN MADE ice chopper, your search is over. This thing is EXACTLY what I've been looking for. It's heavy duty, has a beautiful handmade weld and a very sturdy rubber (not foam) handle on top. Heavy enough to cut through thick ice but not so heavy that your arm is tired after a few minutes of chopping. It is one of those tools that you buy once and have for life.
customer_reviews.author: Quad Flyer

customer_reviews.title: Watch Out Ice!!!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this before the winter of 2018 and I held off on doing a review until we were done with the cold weather. I didn't know how much we were going to be using this to break up ice, but we ended up using this thing very regularly. We ended up with a very thick ice layer on a huge section of our concrete and we used this bad-boy to break up the ice which allowed us to clear up the concrete. We even used this on tough to scrape snow on the driveway. This is heavy enough to break through most any ice and it is very well made. We look forward to using this again next Winter.
customer_reviews.author: Fahillion Tech

customer_reviews.title: Quality Control Issues
customer_reviews.text: While the product appears to be sturdy with solid construction and welds, mine arrived with a poor edge finish. There was an uneven finish and a small gouge on the edge of the scraper. This did not appear to be related to shipping but poor finishing and perhaps mishandling at the factory. Rather than return and wait for another unit, I chose to use my bench grinder and finish the edge myself.
customer_reviews.author: Colorado Mtn Hiker

customer_reviews.title: Animalistic, Durable. Every Klingon Needs One.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is an animal. I used it to great effect this winter on an icy sidewalk and driveway where ice thickness varied between half an inch and about 3 inches. It's extremely durable, takes a pounding, and just the right weight. The blade is thick enough and has just the right edge on it. I highly recommend this tool for ice-slaying. If Worf didn't have an Bat'leth, this would be his weapon of choice. Every good Klingon should have one.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Papagiorgio

customer_reviews.title: Boston Strong -- This Cuts It!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent tool -- carves through snow banks thrown up by snowplows so walk can be cut through to the street and car can be pulled out of driveway. And I'm talking Boston 5+ snowbanks. Outline what you want to remove by first making vertical cuts and then a horizontal cut across the bottom of the bank. Start at the top and chisel out and remove sections of the bank, working your way to the bottom. Repeat until you're clear to the street. Makes a nice clean sturdy cut with rigid, no-collapsing sides. A bright spot in a grim winter!
customer_reviews.author: Starfishin

customer_reviews.title: Broke after two minutes of light use
customer_reviews.text: The welds did not penetrate the steel. This scraper broke within 2 minutes of use. I purchased this after watching a video of two men using it to break a cinder block. I barely put any stress on it and it broke right off. I was extremely disappointed that it was not as strong as advertised. I will be returning this in two pieces.
customer_reviews.author: SLC

customer_reviews.title: Bully Ice Scraper
customer_reviews.text: I just received my Ice Scraper today, it was very well packaged, it looks like a good sturdy ice scraper, has a nice weight to it. My question Is about the edge. The edge is about 6 inches long, 4 inches that is flat, there’s no edge to it 2 inches has a small bevel. This does not seem conducive to scraping ice to me. I have not used it yet. I contacted Bully via their website and this review (for some reason they're are not accepting the review). No response, crickets.
customer_reviews.author: Neal Baker

customer_reviews.title: Perfectly destroyed the ice rink behind my garage
customer_reviews.text: This worked great for breaking up the ~3" ice sheet that forms behind my garage door after each snow. It takes some work to get through it, but it works well as a wedge as well so you can get under the ice to break it up. It's heavy and seems durably built, so I think this will last a long time. Just remember to wear gloves while using it to save your hands from blisters!
customer_reviews.author: Mmlissa

customer_reviews.title: What a Great Tool!
customer_reviews.text: If you live in an icy area, you simply must have this! It will save you from destroying your snow shovel edges trying to remove packed ice. I am confident that you will only need to make this purchase once as it seems more than tough enough to last a lifetime. It makes quick work of packed ice. Buy this. You will not be sorry!
customer_reviews.author: Trying to Help

customer_reviews.title: Great tool for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great tool for the price. We've had multiple snow storms since Christmas and ice build up on our walkway an drive way, so this has come in handy. Unfortunately my health has left my wife to do the shoveling and me to write the reviews. She really says it cuts right thru icy slush with just enough weight to make the job easy. We had been trying to break ice away with a shovel, a time consuming task without much success. Now break the ice and shovel away in only a fraction of the time. I did compare these with those available at home depot and lowe's and none reached the quality of the Bully Tools.
customer_reviews.author: OBG

customer_reviews.title: better than I exspected
customer_reviews.text: right out of the box I notice that the edge was blunt, I thought it would be chiseled, I figured I would have to grind it for better results. but to my surprise not only did it bust up the ice with ease but I was able to scrape a lot of it away without busting into little pieces. very nice tool. it's a must have if you live in New England
customer_reviews.author: jynx1966

customer_reviews.title: NeedS a bigger beefier brother!
customer_reviews.text: Good design just needs to be a bit heavier duty throughout the head of the tool. Lasted exactly 1 calendar year. I tore the cutting head at the weld. To be fair, I live at 6,800 feet in an alpine environment. Sheet of ice covering drive way due to bad roof angle planning! This tool helped me conquer the “sheet” many times. I have a thing about getting down to asphalt!
customer_reviews.author: Magnificent

customer_reviews.title: Solid and sturdy!
customer_reviews.text: Hubby loves this thing!! Was able to get under the layer of ice easily, and break it up! Wanted to get that layer off, before the snow on top of it melted into even MORE ice. He likes that it is a serious tool, made very sturdily!
customer_reviews.author: Susan K.

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, effective ice breaker
customer_reviews.text: I use this to break ice that forms in my driveway. It is very sturdily build - it will last a lifetime. It is heavy, so it works by just dropping it. You can also pry up ice without worrying about breaking the handle. It is much better than my old one, a blade screwed onto the end of a wooden handle.
customer_reviews.author: Eric S. Posmentier

customer_reviews.title: Great to Have at Your Fingertips!
customer_reviews.text: This ice scraping tool was a must-have for we old folks this winter. I think the length & weight helped not to have to apply much pressure on the cement driveway/sidewalks to get the ice started. At first I thought I'd be worn out because it felt so heavy but I just laid it at the edge of the ice & walked & slid the scraper. Ice was probably up to a couple inches thick this winter so in some places I sprinkled ice melter to help start the melting process. Our snow shovel just wouldn't do the job.
customer_reviews.author: gee

customer_reviews.title: Tackles Ice in Vermont's Cold Winters!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best ice scraper ever! After bending and breaking several ice scrapers and chippers, we decided that we needed to upgrade to a heavy-duty model. The steel handle is welded to the blade and has not moved a millimeter since we started using it. The weight provided by the steel handle helps me to gain momentum when clearing ice dams and we were constantly impressed with this high-quality and durable product! If you are looking for an ice scraper, your search is over! Buy this and happy scraping!
customer_reviews.author: Allison Reed

customer_reviews.title: Seems well made and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I haven't used this yet but it seems very well made. If I have any problems after using during the next snow event, I will update my review. I think you could also use this tool for many other applications.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Pretty tough Bully - Ice Scraper, that is....
customer_reviews.text: This is a simple tool, seems pretty solid - not likely to degrade quickly from usage. One suggestion would be to taper to a blade edge, this one is more blunt, thicker at the end. However, that will probably permit it to last longer. I use it to remove the packed-down, iced-over tire tracks that snow shovels suck at doing as well as other iced-over areas.
customer_reviews.author: Lead-foot

customer_reviews.title: Made it through the icy Wisconsin winter!
customer_reviews.text: Did a great job with all the ice we had in Wisconsin this winter. I chipped away some really thick spots on my driveway. If you stick to using one side of the chisel you can actually create an edge that really cuts into the ice. I used it to scrape away some of the more slush icy & it did a great job. Heavy enough to get through the tough stuff but female friendly for my arms. The weight was just right. I endorse & reccommend.
customer_reviews.author: Geni G.

customer_reviews.title: Heavy Duty Ice Chopper
customer_reviews.text: This item is how ice chopper/scrapers should be made. One piece of steel from handle to blade. It's more expensive (but worth it) than the cheap ones that have a life expectancy of a storm or two. I keep the chopper blade in a bucket of sand that has a little vegetable oil mixed in with it. This prevents the blade from rusting.
customer_reviews.author: bob y

customer_reviews.title: Heavy Duty Is Right
customer_reviews.text: This scraper works well but it is heavy and tall. I'm 5/5 and 115 lbs and I handed off the ice breaker job to someone else when it came to handling the frozen ice on our patio. However, I could use it just fine for breaking up the bottom layer of icey snow when we got pummeled by the blizzard recently. A winter necessity, hopefully just one you do not need to use often. If I didn't have other's around to help with the work, I might look for a small/lighter option. Quality is very good.
customer_reviews.author: BK NY

customer_reviews.title: Quality issues
customer_reviews.text: Rubber part on the handle torn on arrival. Bought this due to it being 100% made in USA. Highly dissapointed in the quality.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Strong, sturdy, and effective
customer_reviews.text: Thought about one with shock absorption and glad that I didn’t get it. You need a solid piece to break ice. This is also much better than my old wood handled version.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Chase

customer_reviews.title: Superb
customer_reviews.text: The glacier in front of my driveway stood no chance. All was decimated in my path. Doubles up as a fitness work out, as it is quite heavy
customer_reviews.author: Shelf Caribou

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding and Great Quality
customer_reviews.text: This is an outstanding ice chopper. I get lots of ice here in New Hampshire and this makes fairly quick work of removing it. Very sturdy and well built. Has a lot of heft to it, so you can break up ice easily.
customer_reviews.author: Mo Lacourse

customer_reviews.title: Great tool
customer_reviews.text: Recently used this to de-ice my driveway after a huge ice storm in New Hampshire. This helped removed the ice quickly and effectively. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: IT WORKS PERFECTLY
customer_reviews.text: Works perfect. I read a couple of review and some folks said it wasn't sharp enough, folks it's not make for making Ice Sculptures, it's made for breaking ice. In my case I am breaking ice on cement. Due to poor design of my garage and a shed I have a lot of ice build up. Perfect and good price.
customer_reviews.author: JMB

customer_reviews.title: Great snake killer.
customer_reviews.text: We don't get much ice to chop in Oklahoma but we have plenty of snakes needing their heads chopped off. Heavy made but not so heavy the wife can't use it. We keep one at every door.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Made solid
customer_reviews.text: I've had my fathers for the past 30 years but it was made so long ago that it didn't hold up this past Winter. This one I know will go the distance.
customer_reviews.author: DL

customer_reviews.title: Great Tool
customer_reviews.text: This does exactly what I needed it to. We had a lot of ice buildup on our porch. I live in Bush Alaska and had to have something with some power behind it. We sprinkled some ice melt and went to town chopping and scraping away at it. This is built to last.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany

customer_reviews.title: Sidewalk scraper
customer_reviews.text: We've managed to break a few of these, but I doubt we will break this one. It is definitely well made and heavy duty.
customer_reviews.author: 98northwood

customer_reviews.title: Heavy Duty
customer_reviews.text: This winter Chicago was hit with snow and ice. This scraper made it easy to remove ice and packed snow from sidewalks. The scraper is heavy duty and can take a lot of abuse.
customer_reviews.author: APalmo

customer_reviews.title: Worked well
customer_reviews.text: It worked well for this “little old lady” Chopped through several inches of ice. Excellent quality sturdily constructed.
customer_reviews.author: TLC

customer_reviews.title: Work's great
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a sturdy ice chopper, as I live in MN. This has been great so far. It is well made and has held up to my ice challenges so far.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth A Boelke

customer_reviews.title: Great for chipping ice
customer_reviews.text: The snow plow likes to leave a mountain of ice across the end of my driveway. This tool is heavy, but the weight aids in chopping those glaciers into bite size chunks.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Best ice chopper/scraper I've ever had
customer_reviews.text: I use a chopper/scraper to remove ice from my driveway, sidewalks and other concrete surfaces after the snow is cleared off. This chopper does a great job. It's heavier than others that I've had, so be advised that it takes a little muscle to use it for any extended period of time. It is solidly constructed, and the blade looks like it will resist wearing down. I think this is the last one I'll ever need to buy. I'd recommend it to anyone in the upper midwest for residential winter use.
customer_reviews.author: William Z.

customer_reviews.title: Brawny
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy...cleaned the ice off of the driveway. All steel all American..nice grip.
customer_reviews.author: 65 Chevy

customer_reviews.title: I'm ready for the ice!
customer_reviews.text: Last year's snow wasn't a problem but getting the car over 6" of packed ice in front of the wheels...impossible! I'm holding my new weapon and defy the ice to be a problem this year! It feels perfect and it's built to do exactly what no snow shovel can and that's break up ice. I hope I don't need it this year but I'm grateful to have it, just in case!
customer_reviews.author: O'Malley Lin

customer_reviews.title: Beats the old flat edge of a shovel method by a long shot.
customer_reviews.text: Bought late season so only a couple of hours of use, but it did a good job...especially moving ice that was slightly separated from the surface (NOTHING works on ice that is sealed to pavement). I don't think a 5 star ice chopper exists, but this thing is solid and will outlast its owner.
customer_reviews.author: bob

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Light weight yet very sturdy. Seller went above and beyond to accommodate us.
customer_reviews.author: C. Torres

customer_reviews.title: Chopper plate will bend if you are not careful
customer_reviews.text: While using this product for the first time, I was chopping through hard snow and I began to wiggle and bend it from side to side, upon removing the tool from the snow, I had found that it had bent the chopper plate. Product is fine, just beware the chopper plate will bend if you are not careful.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: In retrospect I might have gotten an ice breaker with ...
customer_reviews.text: In retrospect I might have gotten an ice breaker with a D handle, but after unpacking I immediately went outside with this to take my pented up rage out on the awful ice in the driveway my car kept getting stuck on. A second handle with a D grip would help in that 'scooping' motion you gotta use to break the ice off the driveway or sidewalk.
customer_reviews.author: Alan Pace

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Performance
customer_reviews.text: Excellent and well-built tool. I just used it after the last ice storm, and it worked like a charm. The ice was up to 1.5" thick and, for most of it, I just had to drop the tool and let the weight of it break the ice for me. For the really thick sections, I had to use some elbow grease but - - wow - - in both instances, it worked great. Anyone who lives in winter needs to have this in their winter tool collection.
customer_reviews.author: LAwoman

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy and can handle thick ice
customer_reviews.text: This tool is a beast! Very sturdy and can handle thick ice. Eats it up and laughs at it. Would strongly recommend it for its heft, weight and durability. Have had two other friends buy it because they too have enjoyed the feel and heft to it.
customer_reviews.author: J. Trujillo

customer_reviews.title: Nothing like a good ice breaker...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to kill rattlesnakes, not much ice in West Texas :) Very heavy duty, sturdy construction and I’m sure will break ice. It feels like it could bust concrete and is good at taking out said snakes
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: U S A!!
customer_reviews.text: This product is advertised as having been produced domestically, which I find amusing since it's basically a rod of metal with sort of a crude blade affixed to one end. It works ok. Handle could use more padding. Will probably last forever if you keep an eye on it.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas Martin

customer_reviews.title: Great tool in the harsh winter months!
customer_reviews.text: WOW! I love, love, love this tool. It has a good amount of heft/weight to it, so it takes very little effort to break up the ice. I used it as a scraper, and it broke up the ice very easily. It is well-constructed and really did a great job during Winter Storm Jonas. This tool really helped to clear down to the concrete and I am confident this product will last a lifetime. Excellent!
customer_reviews.author: mpovell

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: In one word with the snow and ice we have had this year this has been a life saver, will chop or scrape through pretty much anything. I used it to chip away the berm left by the snow ploughs at the end of the drive which was 2 inches thick. It has some weight but you still need to put in some work, is much better built that those ones that look like a small spade, this is a solid piece of metal I expect it to last years.
customer_reviews.author: Andynj

customer_reviews.title: Really Heavy
customer_reviews.text: This is great. It is quite heavy so it does most the work for you. It's good quality was able to break through several inches of ice making quick work of it. Also used it on about 8" of hard packed snow without any problems. Plus you get a great arm workout while using it.
customer_reviews.author: K. J

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: This is a great quality product. It's heavy, so I know it'll work for what I need, but if you're looking for something light-weight, you might want to look at something else.
customer_reviews.author: J. Clark

customer_reviews.title: Made in the USA
customer_reviews.text: I finally got to use this product and it works great. It's just the right weight for chopping up chunks of ice.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: solid tool!
customer_reviews.text: definitely a solid tool! love it! it definitely gets the job done. great for chopping and scrapping. super satisfied with it.
customer_reviews.author: Tina

customer_reviews.title: Worked great if you like manual labor
customer_reviews.text: Worked great if you like manual labor. I like how it's put together, the last one I had was made with plastic housing around the blade that didn't last very long. Additionally due to the long spade, you can really get underneath if you need to and pull up. Besides being on the heavy side (not for me, thinking of others) it's a great tool for dealing with ice.
customer_reviews.author: Kolinl79

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed
customer_reviews.text: Could not find an ice pick anywhere and went to my favorite favorite online store and they came through. Read the reviews and after two days voila! This product took 30 mins to clear my some annoying driveway ice 2-3in thick. 5lbs of hurt is what is is. Not seeing what the few low ratings are complaining about. Buy it.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Worth it
customer_reviews.text: Glad I spent the the extra. They have less expensive ones at the hardware store but they are Chinese junk with light handles. This thing is heavy the blade is thick. Watch your ass ice.
customer_reviews.author: TheSpaceWanderer

customer_reviews.title: Ice Chopping Perfection.
customer_reviews.text: The design is seamless and perfect. The product is solid. Heavy. Lift it and it does the chopping. The handle is comfortable and sufficiently grippy. Great tool! Don't use it on stained concrete, though.
customer_reviews.author: Someone

customer_reviews.title: Winter Wonder
customer_reviews.text: Heavy enough to just be able to drop it on the ice and it breaks it up. For larger ice portions, you have to plunge it down, but it cuts in easily. Do small sections at a time and it works wonders. Small ice sections melt much faster. I love it!
customer_reviews.author: DooWopFan

customer_reviews.title: Good to have in Montana for getting ice of steps, walks, etc
customer_reviews.text: Super heavy duty, heavy steel and can break up any ice with enough effort. Can wear you out since it weighs so much and vibrates when you really go for it
customer_reviews.author: cavaliersam

customer_reviews.title: The good reviews are accurate
customer_reviews.text: Based on the reviews, I bought this ice chopper/scraper, and glad I did. This ice chopper/scraper works well, the welding looks and feels sturdy, and I like the long handle (less bending) and hefty weight (more power).
customer_reviews.author: MeB

customer_reviews.title: Great for Ice Storms!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great device when you have a "Ice Storm" like we did here in MD in March 2017. We really had to try and get snow away from our tires. This device is great! Now we have a snow shoveler and ice shoveler!
customer_reviews.author: Laurie

customer_reviews.title: Very strong and well made.
customer_reviews.text: Finally, I've bought this to break ice for the winter time. This is a great product, very strong, and it looks like it will last a life time.
customer_reviews.author: Leo Lee

customer_reviews.title: easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I have arthritis and am older...even so this tool was easy to use and worked well at breaking ice!
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen Herfurth

customer_reviews.title: Great tool for Minnesota winters
customer_reviews.text: Not a light wimpy tool, this thing is made to pound through ice without the effort that a lighter ice chopper requires. Being in Minnesota it's pretty important to have very good tools to deal with ice and snow so I consider this a very, very good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: MN Sunny C.

customer_reviews.title: Really does the job
customer_reviews.text: Love this! I had ice all up and down my road and driveway and we chopped the ice down a very large section of the roadway in about 20 minutes. It's so much easier than trying to work with a shovel. It's light and tall enough. Extremely sturdy and well-made. I'm 67 years old and it really is easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: M. Cohen

customer_reviews.title: Ice Chopper a Great Tool
customer_reviews.text: We had some big snow storms in Southern MD this year and we had quite a bit of ice in our gravel driveway that took a long time to melt. I remembered I had an Ice Chopper in my youth and thought to look at Amazon to see if any were available. I found and ordered one, which arrived in time to let me chop some serious ice in a short time. Once the ice was chopped, it melted away much more quickly. Great tool!
customer_reviews.author: Ruffo

customer_reviews.title: Bent within 2 weeks
customer_reviews.text: Bent on 3rd use trying to clear some hard packed ice/snow that came off the roof of the garage. Not impressed with the quality of the metal used. Welds seem study.
customer_reviews.author: ridered777

customer_reviews.title: Best ICE CHOPPER EVER!
customer_reviews.text: Best ICE chopper EVER!! I've had wooden and plastic handles that break. This one is ALL metal, that will last my lifetime!
customer_reviews.author: kenn bekker

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and does the job
customer_reviews.text: I used it just the other. I was able it with my left hand and I’m a righty.
customer_reviews.author: Eileen S.

customer_reviews.title: great tool!
customer_reviews.text: I just got this today. I live in Michigan and we are experiencing the "Artic Vortex" I have about 3 inches of ice on my drive way. I was able to break through all of it and scrape it off with ease. I don't know why other people are saying it didn't work for them or they bent it. I don't know how someone could bend it. Very good product! Well worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: AJ Camenga

customer_reviews.title: Great Solid Ice Chopper, Worth Every Penny
customer_reviews.text: This is a really great ice chopper. Unlike my previous chopper which had a wood handle, this one is steel and you can feel the difference. Its heavier and by far studier. The extra weight helps it to break through ice patches on its own without much extra effort required unless the ice is thicker than an inch or so. My previous chopper broke in two where the blade met the wood handle...I find it unlikely for that to happen with this brand.
customer_reviews.author: Spencer Agnew

customer_reviews.title: well made
customer_reviews.text: heavy duty and well made. Actually am using it now to chip grass around holes put in yard by my neighbors cattle.
customer_reviews.author: P. Harding

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm for all the icy build up under ...
customer_reviews.text: This has saved my and my husband's backs this winter. Works like a charm for all the icy build up under our tread tracks.
customer_reviews.author: EJ DeCamillo

customer_reviews.title: Nice tool for the price
customer_reviews.text: Nice tool for the price, I would recommend buying the heaver model if you need to crack ice thicker than an inch. It does get dull fast but that is expected for slamming it down on concrete.
customer_reviews.author: Here we go again!

customer_reviews.title: Awesome piece of American Craftmanship!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome piece of American Craftmanship! I used this all winter long to break up ice and it held up pretty darn good that I purchased another one to keep at my parents house. The 2 other ones I purchased before this one from a local home improvement store did not even last 1 use.
customer_reviews.author: EF from NJ

customer_reviews.title: Does the job but coating chips easily
customer_reviews.text: This ice chopper was extremely helpful in breaking up the ice block that was my driveway this winter. One thing I did not like was that the black coating chipped off in several places the first time I used the chopper. It only took the first few hits to the ground for the underneath to be exposed.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Works well. Blade bent at the tube while dealing with the icing from this weekends storm. Good for the price. Will likely take it to a steel shop and have the blade reinforced. Sturdy handle. Padded grip could be a little longer.
customer_reviews.author: JCTXVA

customer_reviews.title: Works Perfect
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item as a Christmas Gift and lucky for us, the Blizzard of 2013 struck hard. This tool was extremely helpful in breaking up the icy snow which fell first and was then covered by 1.5 feet of soft, fluffy stuff. Having the icy portions gone before having to shovel out the 2+ feet of snow was a bonus. There were no pieces/chunks of ice too tough for this Ice Chopper to tackle. THANKS so much.
customer_reviews.author: Eleanor J Woodward

customer_reviews.title: Great for clearing ice
customer_reviews.text: This tool is heavy duty. It is great for breaking up ice and for clearing our driveway. We first bought this back in 2008 after an ice storm, and after many, many years of use in harsh mid-west winter conditions, it’s still in great condition. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: val321

customer_reviews.title: Makes removing ice easy
customer_reviews.text: Perfect tool for the ice. A bit heavier than I anticipated but should be to get thru ice.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product - high quality!!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing product! Love that it's made it US A - so strong and sturdy. Takes ice up no problem. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Stacy Heath

customer_reviews.title: this takes care of it beautifully! Well made
customer_reviews.text: We get a lot of ice forming on the roadways here on the farm, this takes care of it beautifully! Well made, truly heavy duty
customer_reviews.author: Mack

customer_reviews.title: Ice-busting beast
customer_reviews.text: Haven't had to use it this year, but it's sturdy, weld looks solid, and it's a heavy beast so it should bust up ice well. Note handle is metal and will get cold, but you were going to be wearing your gloves anyhow, right?
customer_reviews.author: contranym

customer_reviews.title: Very durable and well built. After only a few ...
customer_reviews.text: Very durable and well built. After only a few used, the rubber handle on the end split, but the product is still useable.
customer_reviews.author: Evan Lloyd

customer_reviews.title: this is it
customer_reviews.text: If you are looking to buy an ice chopper, THIS is the one to get. It is very well made, solid construction, heavy. Made from a solid piece of steel its built to last and worth spending the extra money.
customer_reviews.author: DonV

customer_reviews.title: Goodbye ice blocks
customer_reviews.text: Saved me some serious trouble in getting rid of giant ice block buildups that had occurred on the steps in front of my house. This tool takes some muscle to make work but once you get a rhythm going, it handles business.
customer_reviews.author: L. Smith

customer_reviews.title: $$ well spent
customer_reviews.text: I get a lot of heavy ice due to daytime melting and overnight refreezing. This tool is a good example of how having the RIGHT tool makes all the difference. When used properly it can clear just about anything.
customer_reviews.author: Frustrated lumberjack

customer_reviews.title: it seems as if it would easily break ice
customer_reviews.text: This is a very strange product, a least in my experience. It is heavy, it seems as if it would easily break ice, but it does virtually nothing to even 1/2' of ice. I remember ones that were a lot lighter than this that would break the ice, then once broken you could slide it under the ice and 'shovel' a lot of it up. This does neither, but I have to say I am baffled as to why it doesn't. For the life of me, I can't figure out why it isn't working.
customer_reviews.author: Herbert J. Fellows

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE THIS ICE CHOPPER
customer_reviews.text: I lost my ice chopper and had to replace it. I looked at various hardware stores and couldn't find any that I liked. I loved my old one but I love this one more. It's not too heavy. It has rubber grips and cuts the ice nicely and cleanly without much effort. I totally recommend this chopper.
customer_reviews.author: Karen in NY

customer_reviews.title: Nice piece of steel.
customer_reviews.text: Solid one piece design and good weight. Didn't get a chance to use it yet (not that I'm looking forward to that either).
customer_reviews.author: Ruel Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Entirely recommend
customer_reviews.text: Helped get the stubborn ice that plagued my parents house in their driveway works wonders! A bit heavy so be ready if you're not used to this work!
customer_reviews.author: DK-Chaos

customer_reviews.title: The blade isn't cut straight. There is a notch ...
customer_reviews.text: The blade isn't cut straight. There is a notch offset about 1/3 of the way into the blade, not sure if it is going to cause a weak point when used. I will update after I use it on the thick Colorado ice.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty.
customer_reviews.text: Bought 1, liked it so much, bought another. Heavy enoughbut no fatigue. I used them for commercial use, asphalt maintenance.
customer_reviews.author: Ross Alan Upston

customer_reviews.title: Does a nice job smashing ice
customer_reviews.text: Does a nice job smashing ice. My only complaints are that is surprisingly heavy and the end is rusting (doesn't seem to affect the function).
customer_reviews.author: E. Chen

customer_reviews.title: Stout tool
customer_reviews.text: It's big, it's heavy, it was my wife's purchase so I insisted she at least help with using it. It took her 4 days to recover, like I said, it's heavy. Excellent quality and it did a great job. I will be using it sparingly but I'm happy we have it.
customer_reviews.author: Fredw

customer_reviews.title: Well made
customer_reviews.text: It works okay. Not as well as I had hoped. Good handle made of 1 1/4" steel tubing and a dense rubber handle. Decent enough welding job.
customer_reviews.author: corini

customer_reviews.title: Never can find in stores but love this Item
customer_reviews.text: Well worth the money. Got tired of breaking wood handles. Never can find in stores but love this Item.
customer_reviews.author: R Claus

customer_reviews.title: and it works great. Beats the wimpy light weight ones
customer_reviews.text: Just put this into use, and it works great. Beats the wimpy light weight ones. I use it more for scraping packed down ice, then chopping.
customer_reviews.author: JEM

customer_reviews.title: ice chopper
customer_reviews.text: I was so pleased to get this product. I had something very light and rusted out before due to much use. The one thing I noticed on the chopper was the weight. Whether you need to scrape the ice or chop it, it does the job. It is very well constructed and does the job quite nicely.
customer_reviews.author: T. Brady

customer_reviews.title: Strong, sturdy effective
customer_reviews.text: Just that, it's really well made, has a good amount of weight without being too heavy, and very effectively chops through the ice. It seems like the kind of tool you could have around for decades it seems that well made.
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Ice Breaking Tool for Driveway
customer_reviews.text: Tough, durable and gets the job done quickly. Exactly as ordered and let me get to work on time this last winter. No rust after use and price is reasonable.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Bully Tools 92200 Heavy Duty Sidewalk and Ice Scraper with Long Steel Handle
product_meta.description:
Bully Tools Sidewalk Scraper powers through thick ice and snow buildup. All steel construction provides the weight needed to let gravity do much of the work. The extra thick 11 gauge steel blade is able to chop away thick ice.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Tools made to last a lifetime, and be passed on from generation to generation. 100% Made in the USA Bully Tools is bringing back that tradition with tools built to endure years of hard labor. We have re-engineered the classic designs of shovels, rakes and other popular tools to create more efficient, durable products. Special features on specific products include true 14 gauge steel, triple wall reinforced fiberglass handles, extended length ferrules, and welded I-beam supports. We stand behind our products and offer a limited lifetime warranty. If one of our tools fails during normal use, we will replace or refund it! In a time when cheap foreign products are the norm, Bully Tools offers affordable, high quality Made in the USA goods.
